content: heel flap you will need to pick up additional stitches one for each additional rs row completed in the heel flap section place bor marker for the front 28 32 36 40 stitches work the next round from chart a or b corresponding to where you left off at the end of the leg then place stitch marker pick up and knit one stitch in the gap between the front of the sock and the heel flap and then pick up and knit 14 16 18 20 stitches on the right side of the heel flap k to bor marker round 1 work the next round of the chart to marker slip marker ssk k to the last 2 stitches before marker k2tog round 2 work next round of the chart to marker slip marker k to end continue working rounds 1 and 2 until you have 56 64 72 80 stitches remaining continue working round 2 only until the foot measures the desired length i begin shaping my toe when my sock reaches the top edge of my baby toe alternatively you can start shaping your toe when the length of the foot is approximately 4cm / 1 5 shorter than the desired length of sock 8 toe work one round of stocking stitch in chosen colour for toe and then continue by choosing one of the following toe options to complete your sock toe option a round 1 k1 ssk k1 p1 k to 5 stitches before marker p1 k1 k2tog k1 slip marker twice round 2 k3 p1 k to 4 stitches before marker p1 k3 slip marker twice repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 28 32 36 40 stitches remain ending on round 2 ©2025 by samantha west all rights reserved 7 repeat round 1 until 16 20 24 28 stitches remain toe option b round 1 k1 ssk k to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 slip marker twice round 2 knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 28 32 36 40 stitches remain ending on round 2 repeat round 1 three more times 16 20 24 28 stitches remaining 9 graft your toes using kitchener stitch or seaming method of your choice 10 weave in tail and remaining threads wet block if desired ©2025 by samantha west all rights reserved
